paliDevanagariVerse:
सोपि भगवा अरहं,
सम्मासम्बुद्धो सयम्भू;
विज्‍जाचरणसम्पन्‍नो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
paliRomanVerse:
Sopi bhagavā arahaṃ,
Sammāsambuddho sayambhū;
Vijjācaraṇasampanno,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
englishVerse:
I bow to the Buddha, 
To Him, who was freed from all impurities, the Worthy One, 
Enlightened by his own efforts, Lord of oneself,
Perfect in theory and practice.

vocabularyWords.etymology: vijjā + caraṇa + sampanno - wisdom + practise + being endowed

paliDevanagariVerse:
पुरिसदम्मसारथी,
लोकविदू अनुत्तरो;
सत्थादेवमनुस्सानं,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
paliRomanVerse:
Purisadammasārathī,
Lokavidū anuttaro;
Satthādevamanussānaṃ,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
englishVerse:
I bow to the Buddha,
Trainer of men,
Incomparable knower of all the worlds,
Teacher of gods and men alike.

vocabularyWords.definition: incomparable knower of all the worlds
vocabularyWords.etymology: loka + vidū + anuttaro world/universe + knowing + incomparable/unrivalled

vocabularyWords.definition: teacher of gods and men alike
